text: Prime Numbers have become very important in designing security systems, especially after the three scientists Rivest, Shamir & Adleman have devised the famous RSA Algorithm. We all know that a natural number P > 1 is said to be a prime number if it has no divisors other than 1 and P itself. For example, 2,3,5 are all prime numbers. Here, 11 is a prime number with both the digits being equal. Now, the question is what is the next prime number (greater than 11) having all its digits being equal. Justify your answer!
(Note: Email your answer to gvramesh67@gmail.com Don't forget to write 'Problem Corner - October-17' in the subject for the mail)
